intro: Jacquemontia hirsuta var. trichodonta, commonly known as the hairy leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. This variant is closely related to other species in the Convolvulaceae family, sharing similar growth habits and floral structures.
